author: Yuka Hayashi
title: Mick Mulvaney Promises Accounting for Business Costs in Rule-Making
text:
WASHINGTON—The business cost of complying with rules will receive increased attention at a consumer-finance regulator, the agency’s acting director said, faulting the Obama administration for not giving enough consideration to such factors. 

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, created in response to the financial crisis, has to consider the cost its rules imposed on industry as part of cost-benefit analyses required by Congress. The CFPB acting director, Mick Mulvaney, in his first public speech on Tuesday since being...
